sections.heading: STILL
structure: In negatives → still + auxiliary + not + verb
examples: My brother still lives with my parents.
I can still go into the office.
I still don't know how to use chopsticks.
sections.explanation: Shows something is continuing. Often surprising. Works in present, past, and future.

sections.heading: ALREADY
sections.explanation: Something happened earlier than expected or before now. Position rules stay the same in positives, negatives, and questions.

sections.heading: JUST
examples: I was just talking to him.
sections.explanation: Used for something that happened very recently (seconds, minutes, or even a short while ago).

sections.heading: YET
examples: The judges have yet to announce a winner. (formal)
sections.explanation: We're waiting for something. Shows expectation. Most natural at the end of the sentence.
